required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Multiple Doses of PRS-060 Administered by Oral Inhalation in Subjects With Mild Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: A Dose-Escalating, Single-Blind Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Multiple Doses of PRS-060 Administered by Oral Inhalation in Subjects With Mild Asthma

brief_summary.textblock: Study of Multiple Doses of PRS-060 Administered by Oral Inhalation in Subjects with Mild Asthma

detailed_description.textblock: PRS-060 is a drug candidate being developed for the treatment of asthma. The main purpose of this study is to investigate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of multiple doses of PRS-060 administered by inhalation in subjects with mild asthma.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events (AEs) after an inhaled dose of PRS-060
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of dose until 30 days after dosing
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with treatment related AEs as assessed by current approved CTCAE version

primary_outcome.measure: Change in blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess blood pressure (systolic and diastolic) as a criterion of safety and tolerability variables as measured in mm Hg)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in heart rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in beats per minute (BPM) as a criterion of safety and tolerability variables

primary_outcome.measure: Change in body temperature
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in body temperature in degrees Celsius as a criterion of safety and tolerability variables

primary_outcome.measure: Change in electrocardiograms (ECGs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in cardiovascular system function (change in QTC parameters) as a criterion of safety and tolerability variables

primary_outcome.measure: Change in forced expiratory volume 1-second (FEV1) as part of spirometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in FEV1 as measured in mL as part of spirometry

primary_outcome.measure: Change in forced vital capacity (FVC) as part of spirometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in FVC as measured by mL

primary_outcome.measure: Change in peak expiratory flow rate (PEFR) as part of spirometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in PEFR as measured in L/min

primary_outcome.measure: Change in sodium levels as part of standard serum chemistry panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To asses changes in sodium levels as measured in mmol/L

primary_outcome.measure: Change in potassium levels as part of standard serum chemistry panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in potassium levels as measured in mmol/L

primary_outcome.measure: Change in chloride levels as part of standard serum chemistry panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days)
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in chloride levels as measured in mmol/L

primary_outcome.measure: Change in bicarbonate levels as part of standard serum chemistry panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in bicarbonate levels as measured in mmol/L

primary_outcome.measure: Change in blood urea nitrogen (BUN)/Urea levels as part of standard serum chemistry panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes BUN/Urea levels as measured in mmol/L

primary_outcome.measure: Change in creatinine levels as part of standard serum chemistry panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in creatinine levels as measured in umol/L

primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in total protein levels as measured in g/L

primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in pH of the urine sample

primary_outcome.measure: Change in protein levels as part of a standard urinalysis panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in protein levels of the urine sample

primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in glucose levels of the urine sample as measured by a positive or negative result.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ketone levels as part of a standard urinalysis panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in ketone levels of the urine sample as measured by a positive or negative result

primary_outcome.measure: Change in blood levels as part of a standard urinalysis panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in blood levels of the urine sample as measured by a positive or negative result.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in nitrite levels as part of a standard urinalysis panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in nitrite levels of the urine sample

primary_outcome.measure: Change in leukocyte esterase levels as part of a standard urinalysis panel
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
primary_outcome.description: To assess changes in leukocyte esterase levels of the urine sample

secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: Cmax (observed maximum serum concentration taken directly from the individual concentration-time curve)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the PK after receiving PRS-060

secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: Tmax (time to reach maximum serum concentration, taken directly from the individual concentration-time curve)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the PK after receiving PRS-060

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the PK after receiving PRS-060

secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: AUC (0-last) (area under the serum concentration-curve from time zero to the time of last quantifiable analyte concentration)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the PK after receiving PRS-060

secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: AUC (area under the concentration-time curve in the serum zero [pre-dose] extrapolated to infinite time)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the PK after receiving PRS-060

secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: AUC (0-24) (area under the plasma concentration-curve)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the PK after receiving PRS-060

secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: Vz/F (apparent volume of distribution during terminal phase)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the PK after receiving PRS-060

secondary_outcome.measure: PK assessment: CL/F (apparent oral clearance estimated as dose divided by AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the PK after receiving PRS-060
Evaluation of PRS-060 levels in the urine after receiving PRS-060

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum ADA assessment using bridging Immunoassay Enhanced Chemiluminescence (ECL) method
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of potential development of ADAs against PRS-060

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, during treatment and confinement, 7 days after dosing (±1 day), and 30 days after dosing (±3 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of FeNO after receiving PRS-060 or placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18 to 35
- Subjects who are non-smokers or ex-smokers who have smoked no more than twice in 3 months prior to screening (determined by urine continine < 500 ng/mL, at Screening visit)
- Males and non-pregnant, non-breastfeeding females
- Males who are sexually active with women of childbearing potential must agree to follow a highly effective method(s) of contraception for the duration of treatment with study drug as well as for an additional 90 days post-treatment completion. Women of childbearing potential who are sexually active with a fertile male must agree to follow instructions for double methods of contraception for the duration of their participation in the trial and for 90 days post-treatment completion
- Documented diagnosis of mild asthma
- 18 to 55 years of age
- Lung function ≥ 70% predicted for FEV1 and FEV1/FVC ratio ≥ 0.7
- FeNO ≥ 35 ppb at Screening and during pre-qualification for the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- History or clinical manifestations of any clinically significant medical disorder that, in the opinion of the investigator, may put the subject at risk because of participation in the study, influence the results of the study, or affect the subject's ability to participate in the study
- A history of drug or alcohol abuse
- History of, or known significant infection including hepatitis A, B, or C, Human immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), tuberculosis (i.e., positive result for interferon [IFN]-γ release assay [IGRA], QuantiFERON® TB-Gold), that may put the subject at risk during participation in the study
- History of cancer within the last 10 years (20 years for breast cancer) except for basal and squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or in situ carcinoma of the cervix treated and considered cured. Any history of lymphoma is not allowed
- Any clinically significant illness, infection, medical/surgical procedure, or trauma within 4 weeks of Day 1 or planned inpatient surgery or hospitalization during the study period
- Any clinically significant abnormalities in clinical chemistry, hematology, or urinalysis results, as judged by the Principal Investigator
- Significant history of recurrent ongoing 'dry eye syndrome' of any cause that may be chronic or acute, that may affect the interpretation of safety data associated with the potential for ADAs targeted to PRS-060 (structurally related to tear lipocalin)
- Subjects who have received live or attenuated vaccine in the 4 weeks prior to Day 1
- Subjects with a disease history suggesting abnormal immune function
- History of anaphylaxis following any biologic therapy and known history of allergy or reaction to any component of the investigational product formulation
- Inability to communicate well with the Investigator (i.e., language problem, poor mental development, or impaired cerebral function)
- Participation in any clinical study for a New Chemical Entity within the previous 16 weeks or a marketed drug clinical study within the previous 12 weeks or within 5 half-lives, whichever is the longer, before the first dose of study drug
- Donation of 450 mL or more blood within the previous 12 weeks
- Women who are pregnant, or breastfeeding, or planning to become pregnant within the study period or 90 days post-treatment completion
- Males who are sexually active with a female partner of childbearing potential and who have not had a vasectomy and who do not agree to a highly effective method of contraception from Day 1 to 90 days post-treatment completion. Females of childbearing potential who are sexually active with a fertile male partner who do not agree to double methods of contraception with at least one barrier from Day 1 to 90 days post-treatment completion
- Life-threatening asthmatic episode in the past
- C-reactive protein (CRP) above 5 mg/L
- Use of the following medicines within the specified time before screening:
- Long-acting β2 agonists; none for 4 weeks prior to Screening
- Anti-IgE or anti−IL-5 therapy; for 6 months prior to Screening
- Inhaled corticosteroids (> 500 μg per day of beclometasone dipropionate [BDP] or equivalent) within 16 weeks prior to Screening
- Inhaled corticosteroids; none for 4 weeks prior to screening
- Oral or injectable steroids for the treatment of asthma or respiratory tract infection within 5 years prior to Screening
- Intranasal steroids within 4 weeks prior to Screening
- Topical steroids within 4 weeks prior to Screening
- Leukotriene antagonists within 2 weeks prior to Screening
- Xanthines (excluding caffeine), anticholinergics, or cromoglycate within 1 week prior to Screening
- PRS-060 at anytime
